abstract: Get ready to say "aww" -- these baby animals are too cute for words!
body: Get ready to say "aww" -- these baby animals are too cute for words!
title: Most delightful baby animals

images.alt: A 4-month old female giant panda cub is photographed at the Giant Panda Conservation Center at the National Zoo in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, Tuesday, Nov. 17, 2015.
images.caption: It doesn't get much cuter than this! An adorable four-month-old female giant panda cub is photographed at the Giant Panda Conservation Center at the National Zoo in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, on Nov. 17, 2015.

images.alt: A zoo employee carries three-month old female giant panda cub, born to mother Liang Liang  and father Xing Xing, on display to the public for the first time at the national zoo in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, November 17, 2015. REUTERS/Olivia Harris
images.caption: A zoo employee carries four-month old female giant panda cub, born to mother Liang Liang  and father Xing Xing, on display to the public for the first time at the national zoo in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, November 17, 2015. images.alt: Baby sloth at Zoological Society of London.
images.caption: Somewhere out there, Kristen Bell is having a mini panic attack because this baby sloth is too cute for words! The tiny creature is currently being raised with the help of a teddy bear at Zoological Society of London (ZSL) after sadly being rejected by its mother. The sweet faced, two-toed sloth is named after Johnny Depp's role in the Edward Scissorhands movie -- because of its four-inch-long claws. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit. images.alt: Release of first young seals into the wild.
images.caption: Hi there! An adorable seal pup named Jule peeks out of its basket shortly before being released into the wild on the Beach of Juist Island, Germany on July 28, 2015. This was the first tour of Norddeich seal breeding station to re-introduce animals to nature.
images.imagetitle: Release of first young seals into the wild

images.alt: Release of first young seals into the wild.
images.caption: Run free, little babies! Baskets with three seal pups are opened to release them into the wild on the beach of Juist Island, Germany, 28 July 2015.
images.imagetitle: Release of first young seals into the wild

images.alt: -ALLCOUNTRY
images.caption: What's better than one adorable baby lion cub? Three! A group of one-month-old baby African lions stretch and yawn as they wake up from a nap at their enclosure in Indianapolis Zoo. The lions, two males and one female, were born on Sept. 21, 2015 to first time parents Zuri and Nyack.
images.imagetitle: Baby lion cubs at Indianapolis Zoo

images.alt: Penguin rides a wave in the Falklands.
images.caption: Pigs can't fly, but this penguin certainly can! This little guy defied gravity, appearing to walk on water while surfing a wave on the East Coast beach of New Island in the Falklands, captured by amateur photographer Shanu Subra, during a 26 day ecology expedition.

images.alt: Two new born white lion cubs are seen at the home of Andrzej Pabich, owner of the private zoo in Boryszew, central Poland on October 21, 2014.
images.caption: What's cuter than one baby lion cub? Two baby lion cubs!  These newborn white lion cubs were abandoned at birth on Oct. 18, 2014 and taken into the care of a private zoo owner, Andrzej Pabich, in Boryszew, Poland. Andrzej's wife Anna is pictured here holding the cubs on Oct. 21, 2014.

images.alt: Karis, a one month old lion cub being weighed at Blair Drummond Safari Park near Stirling, Scotland, Thursday Oct. 10, 2013.
images.caption: Meet Karis, the one month old lion cub! This tiny feline is being weighed at Blair Drummond Safari Park near Stirling, Scotland on Oct. 10, 2013. Weighing in at 5kg, the cub will stay with her mother, Teekay until she is 12 weeks old before they are returned to the pride.

images.alt: Miniature pigs at "Erlebnistierpark" Memleben (adventure zoo). Sept. 23, 2013
images.caption: Get ready to say "aww" -- these baby animals are too cute for words! Check out the most adorable creatures in the animal kingdom ... Bigger isn't always better -- take this ridiculously cute miniature pig, for instance. He's barely the size of a dinner roll!

images.alt: Staff members arrange panda cubs in a crib for photos at the Giant Panda Breeding and Research Base in Chengdu, in southwest China's Sichuan province. Fourteen panda cubs were shown to the public at the base on Monday.
images.caption: Baby pandas are cute individually ... a room full of baby pandas is almost too cute to handle! These little cubs made their public debut in Chengdu, China on Sept. 23, 2013.

images.alt: A handout picture taken on 17 April 2013 and made available on 25 April 2013 by the Tobu Zoo Park shows white tiger cubs at Tobu Zoo Park in Miyashiro Town, northwest of Tokyo, Japan.
images.caption: We dare you to find a more adorable bunch! These four white tiger cubs were born at Tobu Zoo Park in Tokyo on March 16, 2013.

images.alt: A veterinarian of the Mulhouse zoo bottle-feeds "Dimbi", a blue-eyed black lemur cub (Eulemur flavifrons) on April 19, 2013, in Mulhouse. There's currently less than 2000 blue-eyed black lemurs in nature.
images.caption: Dimbi, a blue-eyed black lemur, doesn't monkey around when it comes to lunch time.

images.alt: This cute primate is melting hearts after being born in a dramatic emergency cesarean at the Atlanta Zoo, Georgia.
images.caption: If this smiling baby orangutan doesn't melt your heart, we don't know what will. With its big eyes and spiky tufts of hair, the lovable primate has quickly become one of the star attractions at the Atlanta Zoo in Georgia.

images.alt: A White tiger cub growls in its enclosure at the Buenos Aires Zoo in Argentina, Thursday, March 21, 2013.
images.caption: Rawr! It doesn't get much more fur-ocious than this Bengal white tiger cub, who lets out a fierce growl at the Buenos Aires Zoo in Argentina.

images.alt: In this Sept. 2012 photo provided by the Alaska SeaLife Center, the baby walrus Mitik sits in a small pool at the Alaska SeaLife Center in Seward, Alaska.
images.caption: A 15-week-old rescued baby walrus named Mitik makes plenty of waves splashing around a small pool at the Alaska SeaLife Center in Seward, Alaska. Who knew these little guys could be so outrageously cute?

images.alt: A female Amur leopard cub (Panthera pardus orientalis), also known as the Manchurian leopard, looks out of a bucket while it is weight, in the zoo in Leipzig, Eastern Germany Thursday , July 29, 2010.
images.caption: This female Amur leopard cub, also known as the Manchurian leopard, is one adorable bucket of fun.

images.alt: A twin baby panther emerges from its basket while being presented to the media with its sibling at Tierpark Berlin zoo on July 13, 2012 in Berlin, Germany.
images.caption: A baby panther cub born at the Tierpark Berlin Zoo thinks he's scary, but he's just about the cutest, cuddliest ball of fur we've ever seen.

images.alt: One of three Siberian tiger (Panthera tigris altaica) cubs Igor, born 27 April in the Nyiregyhaza Animal Park in Nyiregyhaza, 245 kms east of Budapest, Hungary, is weighed by a keeper during their first public appearance on 24 May 2012.
images.caption: This sweet Siberian tiger cub named Igor is already a basket case.

images.alt: A baby gorilla lays on its mother Rebecca on July 12, 2012 at the zoo in western Germany.
images.caption: A teeny tiny gorilla is so small he fits right in the palm of his mother's hand -- the perfect place for catching some zzz's.

images.alt: A three day old baby male Asian Elephant walks in his enclosure at Chester Zoo in Chester, northern England November 28, 2012.
images.caption: A three-day-old Asian elephant has a lot of growing up to do, but right now he's just the perfect size for melting hearts at Chester Zoo in England.

images.alt: A new born hippo baby is put on the balance in Szeged Zoo, near Budapest, Hungary on December 7, 2012 during his first press presentation.
images.caption: At just three-weeks-old, this baby hippo is already worth its weight in cuteness.

images.alt: A baby hedgehog walks through grass looking for something to eat on a lawn in Frankfurt, central Germany, Friday, Sept. 24, 2010.
images.caption: She's ready for her close-up! A baby hedgehog walks through grass looking for something tasty to eat but gets distracted by a nearby camera.

images.alt: A curious meerkat is pictured on April 29, 2010, beside a plastic post box as part of a photocall at London Zoo to simulate the animals casting postal votes ahead of the May 6 general election in Britain.
images.caption: Every vote counts! A politically-minded meerkat casts a mock ballot in the British general election. What a responsible citizen!

images.alt: Two mini-pig piglets stand next to their mother on September 23, 2011 at the zoo in Hanover, central Germany.
images.caption: These mini piglets have us squealing "aww" as they stand next to their mother at the Hanover Zoo in Germany.

images.alt: A newborn pygmy marmoset (or dwarf monkey) clings to its mother in the Zoo in Lodz, Poland, 21 December 2012. The pygmy marmoset was born few days earlier.
images.caption: Someone's got a monkey on her back -- but she doesn't seem to mind. A newborn pygmy marmoset (or dwarf monkey) catches a ride from its mama at a Polish zoo.

images.alt: A newborn tapir stands next to his sister at the Ramat Gan Safari near Tel Aviv October 10, 2012.
images.caption: Meet your baby brother! A newborn tapir gets acquainted with his big sis at the Ramat Gan Safari near Tel Aviv.

images.alt: Rhino Baby Zwatra (Front) walks outside for the first time with her mother Namaste at Blijdorp Zoo in Rotterdam, The Netherlands, 28 November 2012. Rhino Baby Zwatra was born on 03 November 2012.
images.caption: Like mother, like daughter. Rhino baby Zwatro stays close to mom while munching on a healthy snack at the Blijdorp Zoo in the Netherlands.

images.alt: Baby giraffe "Dorle" stands in the enclosure at the Tierpark Friedrichsfelde zoo in Berlin, on July 24, 2012.
images.caption: Baby giraffe Dorle is just about as cute as they come -- and she knows it.

images.alt: A jaguar baby hisses at the Berlin Zoo on June 12, 2012.
images.caption: A tiny jaguar baby thinks he's tough, but that adorable growl isn't scaring anybody.

images.alt: Kit and Kitty, the twin red pandas born in June, explore their new enclosure on the first day away from their mother at Tierpark Zoo on September 13, 2011 in Berlin, Germany.
images.caption: You can tell these two are siblings! Kit and Kitty, twin red pandas, stick close together as they take a look around their new home in Berlin, Germany.

images.alt: A newly born marmoset sits on the hand of a zoo keeper at the zoo in Eberswalde, eastern Germany on July 25, 2012.
images.caption: It's hard to resist this wide-eyed baby marmoset!
